feed.title: NewsTracker: cyclone or volcano
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Eruption of Indonesian volcano sparks travel chaos
entry.summary:
A 2010 eruption of Iceland's Eyjafjallajokul volcano produced an ash cloud that caused a week of international aviation chaos, with more than 100,000 flights cancelled.

Another Indonesian volcano, Mount Sinabung in Sumatra, has been erupting for two months, forcing the evacuation of more than 10,000 people.

entry.title: Thousands stranded in Indonesian as volcano closes airports
Volcano sparks Java travel chaos
entry.summary:
Ash spewing from a volcano on Indonesia's main island of Java has sparked chaos for holidaymakers as airports close and international airlines cancel flights to tourist hotspot Bali.

Evacuation of residents living near the volcano is still considered unnecessary, but authorities are urging people to wear masks.

The volcano has proven particularly problematic for Australians, who flock to Bali during Australia's school holidays.

entry.title: Scientists emerge from isolated dome on Hawaii volcano slope
Scientists emerge from isolated dome on Hawaii volcano slope
entry.summary: Six scientists who have been living under a dome on the slopes of a dormant Hawaii volcano for eight months to simulate life on Mars have emerged from isolation.

entry.title: Indonesia's Mount Sinabung unleashes new powerful burst
entry.summary: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) - A volcano in western Indonesia unleashed a new powerful burst high into the sky on Saturday, sending hot ash far down the mountain's slopes, an official said.

entry.title: Indonesia volcano erupts in a mighty burst
entry.summary: The volcano has sporadically erupted since 2010 after being dormant for 400 years.

entry.title: Indonesia volcano at high alert level unleashes fresh burst
entry.summary: Authorities say they are closely monitoring the volcano after it was placed at the highest alert level last week.

entry.title: Indonesia volcano at high alert level unleashes fresh burst
entry.summary:
TANAH KARO, Indonesia (AP) " A volcano in western Indonesia that has been spewing clouds of searing gas high into the air let out a new powerful burst Wednesday.

The volcano in North Sumatra province has been shooting smoke and ash more than 500 meters (1,640 feet) into the air since Monday.
